text: Solve this problem step by step.
End with 'DONE.' when you have a solution.
Question: A man lives on the 10th floor of an apartment building.
Every morning he takes the elevator down to the ground floor to go to work.
When he returns in the evening, he takes the elevator to the 7th floor and walks up the stairs for the remaining three floors to reach his apartment.
However, on rainy days, he takes the elevator all the way to the 10th floor.

Why does he only take the elevator to the 7th floor on non-rainy days? 

 Solution: 
<think>
Okay, so I need to figure out why the man takes the elevator only to the 7th floor on non-rainy days.
Let me try to break this down step by step.
First, the man lives on the 10th floor.
Every morning, he takes the elevator down to the ground floor, which is the 1st floor, to go to work.
That makes sense because taking the elevator down instead of walking would save him time and effort, especially if he's going all the way from the 10th to the 1st floor.
In the evening, when he returns home, he usually takes the elevator to the 7th floor and then walks up the stairs for the remaining three floors to reach his apartment on the 10th floor.
So, on a normal day, he doesn't take the elevator all the way home; he stops at the 7th floor and walks up.
But on rainy days, he takes the elevator all the way to the 10th floor instead.
Hmm, why would he do that on rainy days? Maybe it's because walking up three flights of stairs is more cumbersome, especially when it's raining.
Walking in the rain can be slippery, and carrying any bags or items while walking up stairs might be more uncomfortable or even dangerous.
So, on non-rainy days, he probably prefers to walk up the stairs because the weather is nice, and it's more convenient for him.
However, on rainy days, he opts for the elevator because it's quicker and more comfortable to avoid getting wet and dealing with the hassle of walking up the stairs in the rain.
Wait, but why specifically the 7th floor? If he takes the elevator to the 7th floor, he still has to walk up three floors.
So, maybe the elevator stops at the 7th floor, and he gets off there, leaving the rest for walking.

But why not take the elevator all the way on non-rainy days? Maybe because the elevator only goes to the 7th floor at a certain time, or perhaps he prefers to walk up the stairs on non-rainy days for some reason.
Alternatively, maybe the elevator only goes up to the 7th floor in the evening, or perhaps he's trying to save time by walking the last few floors when it's not raining.
On rainy days, he doesn't want to walk in the rain, so he takes the elevator all the way.
Another angle: maybe the elevator is out of service or not functioning properly on rainy days, but that doesn't seem to fit because he takes it all the way up.
So, the main reason is likely related to the weather.
On rainy days, he prefers to stay dry, so he takes the elevator to the 10th floor.
On non-rainy days, he's okay walking up the stairs, hence stopping at the 7th floor and walking the remaining three floors.

So, putting it all together, the man takes the elevator to the 7th floor on non-rainy days because walking up the stairs is more convenient when it's not raining, whereas on rainy days, he takes the elevator all the way to stay dry.

</think>

The man takes the elevator to the 7th floor on non-rainy days because walking up the stairs is more convenient when the weather is nice.
On rainy days, he prefers to take the elevator all the way to the 10th floor to avoid getting wet and the hassle of walking in the rain.
